meanings.definition: (of a dog) to bark or howl loudly in a prolonged manner, typically when hunting or pursuing prey
meanings.sent1: The hound bayed loudly as it chased after the rabbit.
meanings.sent2: The pack of wolves bayed at the full moon in the night.
meanings.sent3: The beagle bayed so loudly that even the birds stopped chirping.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the hounds baying echoed through the forest, signaling the hunt.
meanings.sent5: The baying of the bloodhound was like music to the ears of the hunters.

meanings.definition: (of a person) to shout or cry out loudly and persistently
meanings.sent1: The protesters bayed for justice outside the courthouse.
meanings.sent2: The coach bayed instructions to the players from the sidelines.
meanings.sent3: The child bayed for ice cream until their parents finally gave in.
meanings.sent4: The politician baying for votes made promises they couldn't keep.
meanings.sent5: The fans baying for a goal cheered wildly as the ball hit the net.
